recipes.title: Toasted Coconut Ice Cream {Cookbook of the Month }

extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 vanilla bean, split in half lengthwise
extendedIngredients.name: vanilla bean

steps.step: Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
Spread the coconut on a baking sheet and bake for 5 to 8 minutes, stirring it frequently so it toasts evenly.

Remove it from the oven when it’s nice and fragrant and golden brown.In a medium saucepan, warm the milk, 1 cup of the heavy cream, sugar, and salt and add the toasted coconut. Use a paring knife and scrape all the vanilla seeds into the warm milk, then add the pod as well. Cover, remove from the heat, and let steep at room temperature for 1 hour.Rewarm the coconut-infused mixture. Set a mesh strainer over another medium saucepan and strain the coconut-infused liquid through the strainer into the saucepan. Press down on the coconut very firmly with a flexible rubber spatula to extract as much of the flavor from it as possible.
Remove the vanilla bean halves (rinse and reserve them for another use), and discard the coconut.

Pour the remaining 1 cup heavy cream into a large bowl and set the mesh strainer on top. In a separate medium bowl, whisk together the egg yolks. Slowly pour the warm coconut-infused mixture into the egg yolks, whisking constantly, then scrape the warmed egg yolks back into the saucepan.Stir the mixture constantly over medium heat with a heatproof spatula, scraping the bottom as you stir, until the mixture thickens and coats the spatula.
Pour the custard through the strainer and stir it into the cream.

Mix in the vanilla or rum and stir over an ice bath until cool.Chill the mixture thoroughly in the refrigerator, then freeze it in your ice cream maker according to the manufacturer’s instructions.------------------From The Perfect Scoop

recipes.title: 5 Minute Dairy-Free Chocolate Blender Fondue

extendedIngredients.originalString: 2 ounces (56 grams) cocoa butter, roughly chopped
extendedIngredients.name: cocoa

extendedIngredients.originalString: 15 - 30 drops liquid vanilla stevia, or to taste
extendedIngredients.name: liquid stevia

steps.step: Put the cocoa butter, coconut oil, honey, and cocoa powder in your blender. (I used my Vita
Mix.)
Heat the coconut milk in the microwave until it's very hot but not boiling, about 45 seconds.

Pour the hot milk over the other ingredients in the blender.Start on low and gradually increase the speed until the cocoa butter is fully melted and the fondue is smooth. Scrape down the blender if necessary.Taste and add stevia if desired.
Mix to combine.Fondue will thicken as it cools. To speed up the process, put the fondue in the refrigerator.

recipes.title: Chocolate Salami

steps.step: Prepare all ingredients for the chocolate salami. Make sure that butter is at room temperature.Using a blender or food processor, break biscuit cookies into small pieces. Don't worry if there are little chunks left over, they will add to the character of the sausages.
Add cacao power, and mix together to combine well. To the mixture, add butter, dulce de leche and condensed milk.

Mix to combine. Break pecans into smaller chunks, mix it into the mixture. Scoop out one cup of mixture onto a prepared plastic wrap or parchment paper. Shape the mixtures into a shape of a log. Wrap it tightly with a wrap.Refrigerate sausages for a few hours or freeze it until it hardens. Dust with powdered sugar before slicing the sausage.

recipes.instructions: Prepare all ingredients for the chocolate salami. Make sure that butter is at room temperature.Using a blender or food processor, break biscuit cookies into small pieces. Don't worry if there are little chunks left over, they will add to the character of the sausages. Add cacao power, and mix together to combine well. To the mixture, add butter, dulce de leche and condensed milk. Mix to combine. Break pecans into smaller chunks, mix it into the mixture. Scoop out one cup of mixture onto a prepared plastic wrap or parchment paper. Shape the mixtures into a shape of a log. Wrap it tightly with a wrap.Refrigerate sausages for a few hours or freeze it until it hardens. Dust with powdered sugar before slicing the sausage.

recipes.title: Chocolate Marshmallow Raspberry Parfaits

steps.step: In a large bowl mix together the cool whip and pudding mix until well combined.Scoop filling into a zip top bag, seal tight, and snip off a corner of the bag.Beat together the marshmallow cream, butter, sugar and vanilla until fluffy.Fold in marshmallows.Scoop filling into a zip top bag, seal tight, and snip off a corner of the bag big enough to allow the marshmallows to pass through.In a medium bowl mix together the Cool Whip and raspberry gelatin until well combined.Scoop filling into a zip top bag, seal tight, and snip off a corner of the bag.In a 8 ounce clear container; add layers.Starting with the chocolate then the marshmallow ending with the raspberry.Optional:  Sprinkle with hearts.Cover with plastic wrap and store in the refrigerator until ready to serve.

recipes.title: Veggie Dip Bread Bowl Wreath

extendedIngredients.originalString: 1-1/2 cups diced fresh vegetables such as broccoli, red bell pepper, yellow bell pepper and orange bell pepper - ideally you want a variety of colors
extendedIngredients.name: broccoli

steps.step: Line a large platter with sprigs of fresh dill to create a wreath around the edge of the platter.
Cut a wide well in the center of each roll and remove the top crust. Spoon your favorite Marzetti Veggie Dip into each well.Sprinkle each bread bowl with diced vegetables.
Place radishes around the wreath for additional decoration (and eating!) if desired.
